item.title: Scientist developes a Brain-To-Twitter Interface
item.description: <dd class="wp-caption-dd zemanta-img-attribution"> Image via <a href="http://www.crunchbase.com">CrunchBase</a> </dd> </dl> Adam Wilson, biomedical engineeringdoctoral student at University of Wisconsin-Madison has developed a brain to computer interface which makes it possible to directly write tweets through thoughts. ReadWriteWebwrites: Technically, what Wilson did was come up with an interface combining an Electroencephalogram, or brain wavemonitor, with an on screen keyboardfor selecting letters. The system lights up each key on the keyboard but is able to notice a difference in brain activity when the desired letter for input is lit.
